intro: Lastarriaea linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lastarriaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, pinkish-white inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal or mountainous regions with well-drained soils. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
